summary: Mmmh I wonder what are the fandom’s most anticipated moments from S8 music wise. Me: A scene where Jon’s theme get to shine...
body:
Mmmh I wonder what are the fandom’s most anticipated moments from S8 music wise.

Me:

  • A scene where Jon’s theme get to shine (please ride Rhaegal) like I previously said.
  • The Baratheon theme to make its come back thank to Gendry
  • Every themes mixed in one track for the big battles with everyone involved
  • A new rendition of “Truth” for Boatbaby
  • A Golden Company theme !!
  • More of the mournful rendition of “Light of the Seven” like in “No One Walk Away From Me”
  • A new Jaime theme ? A love theme for Jaime x Brienne ? Arya x Gendry ?
  • A martial remix of the Stark theme for the battle

Ughhh there’s so many possibilities hit us with your best shots Ramin ! And with the last 4 eps being 80 minutes !! The S8 album better be the longest of the 8 lol.

Also please Ramin announce that your GoT concerts will come out on DVD/BR.

tags: Jim I'm a doctor not a queued post
summary: Game of Thrones kills me with the Jon Snow ships.  Jon/Sansa. His protective streak is adorable towards her Jon/Daenerys. An...
body:
Game of Thrones kills me with the Jon Snow ships. 

Jon/Sansa. His protective streak is adorable towards her

Jon/Daenerys. An absolute power couple. 

Jon/Ygritte. Never should have left the cave.

All are cute EXCEPT ALL ARE INCEST, minus Ygritte but she just shoots him instead (note the sarcasm). Don’t tell me “But Jim it’s normal in these times.” Ah yes but so are many vile things. That does not excuse it.

summary: About worldviews apart. D says "we all enjoy what we're good at", and J says "I don't". Taken to mean generally killing people,...
question: About worldviews apart. D says "we all enjoy what we're good at", and J says "I don't". Taken to mean generally killing people, but it doesn't. J imo doesn't think abt killing, but ruling. Bc S told him an episode before, "you're good at ruling". Sure, he's a good killer, skilled warrior, and D's searching for heroes, but actually he doesn't like war, he fights bc he has to. J and D are so different!
answer:
Disagree.

I don’t think Jon considers himself a good ruler. The guy has confidence issues and one compliment can’t change that, especially not when he didn’t even take it to heart. He thought Sansa was buttering him up to soften the blow of the following criticism.

And I actually think he does enjoy ruling and that he felt very happy and validated when he was named king–which he did when he was named LC too. Sure, he didn’t want Sam to nominate him, but then he got chosen and his reaction was this:

Look at that happy little bean.

Growing up the way he did, it’s only natural that Jon would feel more comfortable in someone else’s shadow because that’s what he’s used to. He wasn’t supposed to shine, but that doesn’t mean he wouldn’t want to shine. Confidence issues and a fear of doing something wrong, of associating standing out with negative things, of disappointing others, sure can hold you back. So he doesn’t seek out responsibility, but when it’s given him he accepts it and he, quite naturally, takes charge when needed. Which was one of the traits Sam highlighted while giving his reasons for nominating Jon.

Killing people in combat, on the other hand, that Jon knows he’s good at and I definitely think that’s what went though his mind in that scene.

I doubt killing people was what Dany considered herself good at, though. I’m sure she thought more about conquering and inspiring people and amassing followers and bringing change and whatnot.

Thanks for the ask!

tags: and she would have gotten away with it too if it wasn't for those meddling direwolves
summary: Since the new cool thing in the fandom seems to be connecting Ghost’s white fur to Jon’s white silver-haired Targaryen lineage,...
body:
Since the new cool thing in the fandom seems to be connecting Ghost’s white fur to Jon’s white silver-haired Targaryen lineage, I really think we as a community have to address the elephant in the room. 

Or rather, the Shaggydog in the room. We need to ask what it means for Rickon’s direwolf to have black fur. What is Grrm trying to tell us with this particular color choice? 

Oh no!

summary: honestly, the most heartbreaking thing about the whole catelyn-jon dynamic is that catelyn never hated jon. she hated what he...
body:
honestly, the most heartbreaking thing about the whole catelyn-jon dynamic is that catelyn never hated jon. she hated what he represented, a reminder that her husband (she believed) slept with another woman. she pushed that hatred onto him, because she couldn’t channel that anger and hatred anywhere else.

but catelyn stark is fiercely fiercely loyal to her children, to her family. the most heartbreaking thing is knowing that had ned told her who jon truly was, had she known who’s child he was… catelyn would have loved him. without question. she would have had zero resentment to him, and loved him as fiercely as she loves her own children, her family. 

had catelyn known who jon was, she would never ever have hated him. that’s what makes that dynamic so so painful. and on top of that, ned would have known that. he would have known that he could have made that child’s life less painful by simply telling his wife the truth - but ned was so honourable, and loved his sister so much, that he could and would never do anything to break that trust, and betray jon’s identity. 

catelyn stark is justified in her dislike, it’s understandable. but knowing that she would have unequivocally loved jon if she’d known is just… painfully painfully hard.

summary: Regarding Emila’s interview... Y’all really think that Dany is Jon’s most important relationship ? They know each other for...
body:
Regarding Emila’s interview… Y’all really think that Dany is Jon’s most important relationship ? They know each other for what… one month at most ? 

I think Emilia could be talking from Dany’s point of view. After all, she’s in love with him and she’s used to have every man at her feet. She could think Jon would do anything for her, just like the others did.

But Jon has a family. Shipping aside, I don’t think anyone could best Jon and Arya relationship. After all, she’s his sister (not by blood, but he loves her the same). Arya would always be Jon’s most important relationship, over Dany.

Also, it’s funny that Kit said the opposite (I know he could be biased by his beautiful wife, but still… I find this very telling):

“I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with [Ygritte] — and I don’t think he ever will be “ Source

But Jon has a family. Shipping aside, I don’t think anyone could best Jon and Arya relationship. After all, she’s his sister (not by blood, but he loves her the same). Arya would always be Jon’s most important relationship, over Dany.

Also, it’s funny that Kit said the opposite (I know he could be biased by his beautiful wife, but still… I find this very telling):

“I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with [Ygritte] — and I don’t think he ever will be “ Source

summary: I wonder if Jon and Dany had been raised together. Would they had fallen in love if Rhaegar had been made King? Would Rhaegar...
body:
I wonder if Jon and Dany had been raised together. Would they had fallen in love if Rhaegar had been made King?

Would Rhaegar had carried on the Targaryen family tradition and married Jon to his half sister Rhaenys or would she be married to her other brother Aegon? Or would Aegon have been paired off with Dany? 

Though I had a feeling that Rhaegar was all about new blood in the Targaryen blood line. So if Jon and Dany had shown that they had feelings for each other, it would have been forbidden? I would guess that after all that happened, Rhaegar would have married both his siblings and all his children off carefully for the strong alliances.
